contextId.information: The nominal adjective "dead" can be stated as an adjective or a verb. AT: "my dead wife" or "my wife who has died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The nominal adjective "dead" can be stated as a verb or simply as "wife." AT: "my wife who has died" or "my wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The nominal adjective "dead" can be stated as a verb or simply as "wife." AT: "Go bury your wife who has died" or "Go bury your wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
